text: Golden colour, white head. Aroma of malt, straw and butter. Malty flavour, bitter touch, vegetables and twigs. Bitter finish, green twig.(from draught @ GBBF 14, London)

Small white head with fair retention and lace. Clear, golden colored Ale. Slight nose of citrus,ink, malts and some berry notes.Light bodied, mild carbonation. Dry malts, light citrus, some buttery notes. Dry finish, grainy, tame bitterness. Draft/growlered from statelineliquors.
Draught. Hopinn, newcastle-under-lyme. Juicy, like liquid fruit gums. Another great beer from Magic Rock.
Cask at Hopinn, Newcastle under Lyme. Pours golden amber. Quite a piny ale probably a touch too much. Enjoyable though.
Keg at the Victoria, Birmingham. Sappy, perky, glistening Golden. Really nice sappy taste. Nice bite, with zest which leaps off the teeth.

Tap at the Victoria, Birmingham. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is big tropical citrus fruit. The flavour is moderate bitter with a zesty citrus, pine needle hop bitter, light spicy pepper, light yeast palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear golden - white head. Light buttery/diacetyl. Knækbrød. Some hops. Light light bitterness. Toasted. Light bitterness. Boring - and diacetyl

Apr 2015 - Cask at Draft House. Dirty orange brown, hazy, still, small foamy off-white head, thick lacing. Aroma is toffee, raisin, cardboard. Body is medium, a little foamy, low carbonation. Taste is cardboard, musty earthy hop, twiggy, touches of caramelised and dried fruits, musty bitterness. A good old fashioned bitter rather than a golden ale in my book.
Keg at the hanging bat. Too cold. Light, sweet maltiness, slight bitter taste.

On Draught
Pours a golden color with a good head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is mild, but has a little bit of herbal hoppiness, its got a little raw malt and a little fruitiness. 

The flavor is a nice balance of herbal & fruity malt with some nice toasty malt. The hop bitterness is very satisfying and the beer is moderately dry. All together the beer is well composed, refreshing and all-together enjoyable.
Draught at The Rover, Gotheburg. Clear golden beer with a white head. Hoppy caramel aroma. Hoppy grassy, hay flavour.
At Borefts 2014. Pours golden with a white foam. Grass, hops, some malt. Refreshing.

[ Keg ][ 5oz ][ Churchills San Marcos ][ $2.50 ][ Taster ][ 11.16.14 ]
>> Flatter golden pour, wispy white foam. Flabby carbonation, light bodied, super dry and grassy. Squashy and grassy bright hop aroma with sweet yellow cake. Taste is squashy and grassy hoppy, clean and sessionable. Medium light bitterness.

Draught at Borefts Bier Festival 2014. 
Clear amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of citrus.
Fruity flavour of hops and pine needles with notes of citrus.
Hoppy finish.

From cask. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and light peachy. Bitter, smooth fruity and crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy. Lingering fruity and solid crisp hoppy.

[9/27/14] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2014 in Bodegraven. Clear golden. Lovely hoppy aroma full of tropical fruits. Flavor of fruity hops, rather dry, with nice mild to moderate bitterness. Medium-bodied. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Sampled at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. THX everyone for sharing todays beers.
Clear blond beer. Nose is hoppy and little sweet. Taste is little citrus and quite hoppy.

At BBF 14 
Pours clear blonde, no head. 
Smell is hoppy , bit sweet . Taste is bitter , thin , very green and fresh , not much malts . Good, but 13 in a dozen

On tap @ Borefts Bier Festival 2014, Bodegraven - NL. Color: blond beer with small white head and small carbonation. Smell: hoppy and grassy domination with floral notes. Taste: nice citrus hops taste with good bitterness, well balanced. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: sweet bitterness.
Sampled draft @ Borefts 2014. Thank you! Golden, little white head. Oily, touch olive oil, creamy citrus nose. Good fruity & hoppy taste, med. bitter. Nice brew.
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: trübes goldenes Bier mit wenig weißem Schaum. Geruch fruchtig, bittter, leicht säuerlich. Geschmack malzig, trocken hopfig.

15cl tasting @ Borefts Beer Festival. Golden, clear colour, white creamy head. Light hoppy fruits, but bitter, with sweet firm malts. Medium carbonation, good body, oily mouthfeel. Good flavours despite the low alcohol grade.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2014, London (13/08/2014) - golden coloured pour with white head. Grassy, floral and citrus fruity aroma and taste, splash of grapefruit on the palate, refreshing. Lovely.

Cask at GBBF 
Clear dark golden with a small off-white head, good lacing. Aroma and flavors of tropical fruit and fruity floral 
Nice
Cask at GBBF, 2014. Gold pour with a white head. peach and sweet citrus aroma. Vanilla, citrus and some caramel flavour. Soft fruit linger. Quite nice.

Sampled @ GBBF. Clear yellow golden color, small white head. Nice quite hoppy and fruity aroma. Taste lightly malts, nicely hoppy, nicely fruity, quite subtle bitterness. Average body and carbonation. Lovely hoppy session ale.

Aroma: average bread and toasted malts. Appearance: dark amber, small frothy white head. Taste: moderate sweet. Palate: medium body, minerals, soft carbonation with a average-long bitter finish. Overall: very nice Golden Ale, nice aroma. Pint at GBBF 2014, Kensington.

Cask at gbbf - golden with a beige head. Good retention, weak lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon, grass, hay and passion fruit. Super fruity. Taste starts of bitter grapefruit followed by sweet malts, grass and pineapple. Light body. Super nice.
Cask - Grapefruit and orange. Clear gold with a nice beige head. Nice light grapefruit with a clean finish,

Cask at the 2014 GBBF. Aroma is lovely resin, pine and orange citrus. Golden colour with a small white head. Flavour is chalky, crisp pine hop, orange peel. Nice vibrant hop. Palate is crisp, fairly light.
Tap at Irreale. Pale yellow, offwhite cream. Peachy nose, sparkly, minerally grassy/mossy notes. Metallic dry medium body. Clay and sparkly fruit on the palate. Mealy fresh.
On tap at Biercab. Amber colour with white head. Hoppy, fruity, pineapple aroma. Sweet, fruity, bitter, resinous, pineapple taste. Medium body.
Cask at The Victoria; hazy golden amber pour with a small foamy head, fresh pine aroma, taste has pine and citrus, pale malts, light bitterness, very drinkable.
had this at the gb vs usa craft beer challenge was a very nice beer that would be perfect to drink on a nice hot summers day very refreshing with a good citrus flavors and a little bitter finish

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Clear golden beer with a nice white head. Hoppy caramel aroma, butter, citrus, dough, grapes, herbal notes. Hoppy grassy flavor, hay, floral, citrus, caramel, some pine.

Bucket loads of fruity hops on the nose & tongue. A lovely, luscious cask ale - that makes you want to go mmmmmmm!

Rated by BrewTom

Draught at the Magic Rock 25 Tap Takeover at BrewDog, Shepherds Bush on 31 May. Poured a mid golden colour, with a thin white head and some lacing. Aroma of juicy tropical fruits, brown sugar and biscuity malt. Zesty flavours, some mango and chewy malt sweetness. Finish was quite light; some resin and dry grain in the mix, but it didnt hang around too long.
Tap at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, a crisp and hoppy amber bitter, with tropical fruit and veg notes.

Keg west riding dewsbury. This is my 100th golden ale rating and luckily stumbled across a good to mark the occasion! Golden colour thin head. Aroma is nice tropical hops. Taste is tropical citrus peel slight sweet malts long hoppy bitter finish refreshing. Medium body prickly carbonated. Great summer session ale.

Cervesa molt aromàtica, però en el gust no és el que tesperes.
Cerveza muy aromática, pero en el sabor no es lo que te esperas.

Cask at old house sheffield. Light summer ale which will tempt you into buying another after another. Light, fruity, slightly bready with a hoppy nose but delivers on the palate. High standard of a session ale
Cask @ Old Gate, Hebden Bridge. Golden with a creamy head with a very soured tropical fruit aroma and taste.

Draught, Liverpool Psych Fest 2013. Clear gold looks with a small white head. Some citrus and piney hop present in the nose. Slightly thin flavour wise but the hop presence salvaged affairs. Dryish bitter finish. Balance a little off somehow. Ok but having set such a high standard this isnt their greatest offering.
Oro buona schiuma piuttosto persistente discreto agrumato nita floreale discreta nota maltata buona secchezza buon amaro
Cask at The Nags Head in Reading. This aint bad at all. On the sweet edge of town but worth the visit.

Cask at the O'Connell's, Tampere, Finland.
Slightly cloudy golden colour with a small creamy off-white head.
Strong fruity and piney hoppy aroma with moderate bitterness and some sweet maltiness. The flavour is very strong with hoppy bitterness, grapefruit and resin. The bitterness stays... and stays. Flavoursome. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white hea. The aroma and flavor have light toasted bread, mild herbal notes, pale malts, and light hop character. Pretty light body. Nothing really bad here but nothing stands out.

Tap. Poured clear orange copper color with an average off-white frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate citrus hop and sweet malt aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium citrus bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Good drinkable brew.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good for e style; a mostly transparent orange with foamy off-white head. Smells hoppy, but the pine and tangerine makes for an odd combination. Tastes like it smells with a bit of bitterness as well. Average on the palate. Eh.

On tap at Dutchs. Mostly hazy orange color. Thin off-white head. Leaves nice reaches of lace. Light to medium body. Kind of smooth, crisp carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Caramel malt, bready biscuity malt, and citrus hop. Moderate bitter taste. Light sweet. A good English golden ale, but not mind-blowing. I was hoping for more. My bench mark for golden ale is still Jackie-Os Single-hop series, for me - this doesnt really come close to that level of drinkability and hop character.

Draft @ Euston Tap, Euston NW1. Pours a slightly hazy pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a Fruity malty grapefruit hoppy weak piney aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty grapefruit hoppy finish.
Small sample at Olutexpo 2013, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Citrus, fruits and hops.
Cask @ olutexpo. Almost clear, thin head. Citrusy, herbal, fruity aroma. Flavor has citrus, hops, biscuits. Very dry, bitter finish. Light.-- rated with beerbasher
Aroma is Almost Honey Like sweetness. Taste is light sweetness and light bitterness. Finish is bitter Dry. Light bodt
Tap at olutexpo. Clear golden color, small white head. Aroma is sweet honey, malts, fruits. Malty body, dry hops, sweet notes. Simple and works well.

Cask at CBC Clerkenwell. Clear golden with a small white head. Sweet fruity and light piney hops in the nose, probalbly American hops. Taste is sweet citrusy, some pine, light malt. Light body, slightly tery texture, refreshing medium dry, bitter finish, albeit rather short.
Draught (Oliver Twist, Stockholm) - Amber with a slight haze. Passion fruit, peach and grapefruit in the aroma. Hoppy and tangy taste with biscuity malt, grapefruit, peach and mango detected.

Cask @ HomoSibaris, Barcelona. Pours a dark copper colour with an golden hue and a small foamy head. Aroma of fresh citrus, herbs and some nectarine. Flavour of strong, fresh and crisp citrusy hops, grass, some herbs, pale malts and straw. Lingering bitter and citrusy finish. Nice and fresh, but lacks body and has some unpleasant astrigent notes after couple of sips.

August 28, 2013 - hand-pull cask at Southampton Arms. Clear light amber with a decent lasting off-white head. Aroma is catty and wheaty - Tate follows, more bitter, some alcohol. Average body, astringent and decently carbonated - longish catty finish. Very nice.

One third pint from the cask menu at Hanging Bat.. Next to clear amber, filmy layer, fragile lacing. Mild zesty sweet tropical fruity on the nose. Juicy fruity flavours added by leafy hops. Rounded, semi-dry bittersweet finish, rather short-lived. Feels a bit thin in the mouth. Anyway, a decent British bond ale (Edinburgh 08.08.2013).
Keeps its head nicely, super smooth with low carbonation. A pleasant earthy finish but not really a lot going on here. Somewhat disappointing beer from a usually excellent brewery.

Cask to Hanging Bat. Pours clear with a very small head. No carbonation to speak of. Some mango going on, bit of caramel. Not that exciting to be honest. Disappointing when compared to other Magic Rock beers.

Keg at cask p and k. Slightly hazy dark golden/amber with white head. Aroma is slightly pissy, orange, pine and grapefruit. Taste of grapefruit and pine, orange, little pissy again. Very fizzy. Quite refreshing. Nice
Cask at Sheffield Tap. Decent, golden coloured, juicy quaffer. If it wasnt a Magic Rock beer it would have got a higher rating, but it is, and expectations are therefore higher..

Yes yall yes yall we got the magic rock vibe. So superior to curious. Hops gorgeously pleasant. Stewbert Sandis mom liked and thats good enough for me. Refreshing golden with bags of hoppy flavours.
Half pint at Sheffield Tap. Golden-brown, clear, with a good creamy head. Bitter, dry, with citrus hop flavour. Fair citrus aroma. Reasonable, but a bit of a generic US influence hop beer.

Cask at Pelt Trader. Pours nice amber colour with dense white head. Very nice hoppy tropical fruit aroma - mangos, passion fruit. Medium to light body, little in the way of carbonation. Nice juicy pink grapefruit, follow by a pleasant bitterness. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at BBB. Not their finest but still a cracking beer, I think youd struggle to find many goldens that compare favourably. One dude had four glasses, one after the other, his first taste of Magic Rock. I sent him away with a shopping list, lucky bugger.
Keg at Birmingham Beer Bash. Dark amber body with a decent head. Citrus hops aroma with a smooth, dry, bitter finish. A bit one-dimensional and not Magic Rocks finest but a decent beer.

Cask (gravity) @ The 18th Reading Beer and Cider Festival 2012, Reading, Berkshire England.Clear medium yellow orange colour with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, hop oil. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120503]

Cask at CBC - Clerkenwell, London. Pours clear gold with a small, foamy white head. Crispy straw nose, hay. Light to medium sweet flavor with crunchy hay (big time), some grass, more straw, pale malts generally. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Pretty sturdy malts to finish with lots of dry, crunchy hay. Doesnt distance itself from the pack like other MR beers, but its still a darn nice drink.

Cask @ Akkurat. Pours a lovely dark orange color with a small white head. Flour, red grape, yeast and tropical fruit sweetness in aroma. Fresh and fruity taste. Dark cirtrusy. Quite crisp. Light and smooth. Modern.

Cask (Akkurat, Sweden)
Nice fruity aroma. Refreshing palate, crisp carbonation. Very nice bitter, good balance. Simple, but good. A proper golden bitter, makes most others with the gold/blond moniker stand out as being the gutless beers that they are. Magic Rock have standards, fortunately.

(Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm) Golden amber colour with foamy, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, a touch of resin, biscuits, hints of caramel and fresh floral hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with mandarin, a touch of grapefruit, peaches, biscuity malt and fresh floral hops in the finish. Rather light body, quite dry. Tasty and refreshing. Nice and highly drinkable.

Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy amber. Rich lychee aroma. Mid sweet with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Loads of salted lychee. Very bitter finish. American style hop forwardness, Englist style drinkability. Lovely new wave Brit APA!

Cask at Craft Beer Co. Really nice looking beer, brimming deep gold with a modest head. Softest of toffee notes in the nose, but most bright fruits. Sumptuous mouthfeel, a bit of a dry streak coursing through the beer which makes for a nice harmony of elements. Bright and refreshing.

lovely tropical aroma and flavour.  slightly let down by the lack of carbonation.  nevertheless a cracking drink.

Leeds International Beer Festival

Cask at the Cask, Pimlico - 23/08/12.
Hazy yellow with a thin off-white head.
Hoppy citrus nose with lemon at the fore backed up by grass and a little straw.
Tangy citrus hops in the flavour, sweet malts, grapefruit. 
Medium bodied with a sharp citrus finish,
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask by handpump at Stockbridge Tap, Edinburgh - clear deep gold, thin white head, fruity, citrus, resin hop aroma and flavour, good temperature, moderate carbonation, citrus aftertaste but without the bitterness, nice

Cask at CP&K. It pours golden amber, with a medium white head. The nose is pine, orange citrus fruits (particularly tangerine and grapefruit), zest, pineapple and resinous hops. The taste is tangy orange, tangerine, marmalade, pine, resin, minerals and some underlying caramel, with a deliciously bitter finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Great flavour for this sort of alcohol percentage. Another winner from Magic Rock.
Cask at Craft Beer Co., 17/8/2012. Very nice, hoppy, golden ale. Nice, floral, resinous, spicy hops.
Hand pump at York Tap. Looks like your typical golden ale, until you get a whiff of the loads of tropical fruits and pine. Sweet ambrosia for my palate.
Cask at The Southern. Golden with a white head. NIce aroma. Grapefruit, pine and some tropical element. Body is a touch thin but theres some nice hoppy action in there. Dry finish. Pretty good.
Cask conditioned. Very light citrus fruits in the nose and taste, straw, grass, biscuit, fairly earthy.

Cask @ Red Squirrel 110812
Rich orange amber, hazy, light white head
Aroma - caramel malts, soft orange hops, light grassy, soft zest, mellow fruity hops
Taste - golden caramel malts, soft orangey malts, soft citrus orange zest hop, quite malty, all restrained and soft, good flavour
Palate - soft carb. medium body, smooth palate. Finish - light bitter, soft caramel fruity malt, soft orange zest
Overall - Its the most understated beer Ive had from Magic Rock but its well balanced, lots of soft orange, dont expect a hop bomb. its still a really good beer

Cask. Golden. 
Light fruits in the nose, cereal, biscuit.
Taste: Biscuits, grass, straw, fruits, and bitter hops. 
Prefer this one to Curious. Outstanding!

Cask at The Southern. Pale amber, thick creamy white head. Nice big pine nose, some orange peel, fresh grass, touch of lemon. Soft juicy front, pine, citrus, dry breadiness. Very light grapefruit bitter finish - was expecting it to be much more hoppy. Not bad.

Cask. Clear golden with a small white head. Sweet fruity and light piney hops in the nose, probalbly American hops. Taste is sweet citrusy, some pine, light malt. Light body, slightly tery texture, refreshing medium dry, bitter finish, albeit rather short.

Cask at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a clear orangey gold, very small white head. Aroma is grapefruit and other citrus, a bit of malt too. Taste is similar, grapefruit at first, a little bready too. Medium bodied, little carbonation, dryish finish. Perfectly decent and perfectly pleasant, but underwhelming. Disappointing, by their very high standards.

Cask conditioned	handpump	Cask & Kitchen	Brighton	22/05/12.  A golden beer with a whitishbubbly head.  Some great tropical fruitiness in this.  Nouveau hoppy cat pee notes.  Nice bitterness.  Well crafted with good ingredients.  A proper pale beer.  Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Cask gravity, Northampton BF, Delapre Abbey, 25/05/12. Headless orange gold. Hairy, leafy tropical aroma; tea, lemon zest, blackcurrant. Deep supporting husk overlaid with black Darjeeling and citrus zest bitterness. Grapefruit and nutty linger. Good, but hard to accurately judge how good after its been cooked in a tent for 5 days.

Cask conditioned at The Craft Beer Co. Brighton. Hazy gold with white head. Cor, straight into grapefruit zest from the start, fruity, bitter and quite demandingly dry, it doesnt want you to forget what you are drinking. A bit of a belter.
Draft at Craft Beer Co.  Pours clear gold with a small white head.  Citrus and slightly grassy hoppy aroma.  Same aspects in flavour with a little fruit and high bitterness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Festival 2012. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is big fruityness, some rather bitter floral notes along with nectar and sweet malts. Flavour is fruity, sweet malts, rather bitter hops with some floral notes in the finish. Quite mouthdrying and brutal "junior IPA".

Aroma is peppery, a hint of latex to it oddly, some pine but its quite subtle this one. Flavour is unbalanced; while some sweet malt manages to noise its way in initially its suddenly trampled by abrasive, harsh, peppery rampaging hop bitterness. Some suggestions of complexity beneath it all exist, but the overarching impression isnt too pleasing. An acrid, bitter finish sticks around, concluding a beer that outstays its welcome. Not awful, but definitely not up to scratch.

On cask at Cloisters. Pours a golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of pine, pineapple and caramel. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Really quite bitter. Great!

Cask at Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell, London. An amber coloured pour with a small white head on top. Hoppy, citrus fruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, , bitter, dry, some orange in there. I struggled with this one but I really like Magic Rock.
Light orange in colour. Nose is citrusy, pine, some caramel, toffee. Taste is quite bitter and lasts fairly long. Slight marmalade and citrus. Decent.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Pale blonde with pithy Orange nose. Very bitter, all melon rind and Orange with a mustard cream malt finish.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 Cask at Port Street Beer House. I foolishly ordered a Mikkeller dry stout first up, but the hop aroma from Marcs Carnival just drifted across the table and destroyed the Mikkeller offering. Ordering better next time, a slightly orange/amber coloured beer, with very juicy aromatic citrus hop character, more orange/tangerine than grapefruit so a little sweeter than some. Long bitter finish, awesome beer.

Cask, handpump at The Evening Star, Brighton,Saturday 5th May 2012  This beer struggled a little at first when consumed alongside the Dark Star Revelation however a few more sips and its subtleties started to show through. Hazy gold in colour with slim white head, really sessionable stuff, the hops and citrus flavours show but perhaps this facet it is a little more restrained than with some of their other offerings, nice though and would be lovely just to sit back and have a few of these. Nicely bitter and with a late dryness this is very good.   A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov14  3.5
Cask in Euston Tap. Clear amber white head, nose is cereal barley grain, musty grain, touch of citrous. Taste is malty grainy but with hoppy citrous, touch of pine, touch menthol.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2012 cask at BowBar ... light hazy ... thin white head ... soft dry toffee nose ... dry oily fruit front ... soft orange hop ...light dry tasty but not  my thing ...

tap at brewery ... light amber ... big white head ... floral hop nose ... dry hop... soft bitter ... too ns ... to bitter

cask at red squirell ... golden amber ... thin white head ... soft toffee and passion nose ... light bitter fruits ... light toffee ...ok 3.5

Cask @ CPK. Light golden brown color with a tiny airy head. This beer looks liked iced tea. The nose is honey, fresh cut grass and wheat. Spring water fresh and summery. Light. The taste is light sun-kissed floral orange, pastoral. The finish is slightly harsh light bitter tobacco. Soft carbonation, easy-drinking. Nice, uncomplicated stuff.  Tasty, though I suspect this might not have been drinking at peak form.

Cask at CPK, Pimlico, London on 27th April 2012. Slightly hazy amber with off white foam and almost no lacing. Bitter, rich and intense hop aroma. Grassy hop and rich bitterness in-mouth and a satisfyingly bitter aftertaste.Smoothish mouthfeel and a fair amount of body. Excellent.
Cask handpull at Craft Beer Co. Clear deep gold lasting white head. Really quite aggressively hoppy. Toasty. Quite harsh some toast. Not their best. Still hoppy though.

27th April 2012On tap at the Craft. Clear gold beer, little white bubbly head. Smooth semi dry palate. Fairly rich marmalade hops with some green hops sting. Mild minerals and a trace of lemon on the back end. Finishes semi dry with decent bitter linger. Nice. Great flavour for its modest abv.
